alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:25AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River at Scanlon affecting Carlton County. .Recent rapid snowmelt runoff caused water levels in area rivers to increase over the last week. St. Louis River levels appear to have crested and falling river levels are expected in this area. Expect cooler temperatures with chances of rain Wednesday then snow on Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River at Scanlon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water encroaches buildings near River Gate Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday evening and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.8 feet on 10/13/1973. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 12.9 Tue 9 am CDT 12.2 11.7 11.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 630 PM CDT.
